description:
Redevelopment of the East Yard  erection of extensions
to and change of use of existing buildings within the
Camden Lock Complex  Chalk farm Road to provide light
industrial  retail studio workshop and market facilities
in addition to alterations to the existing pedestrian
access and walkways  as shown on drawing nos.NSD/30A
31A  32A  33A  34A  35B  36A  37A  38A  39A  40A  41A
42  43 and 44 and as revised on 25th June 1987.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The details of the elevations and facing materials to be
    used on the building shall not be otherwise than as shall
    have been submitted to and approved by the Council before
    any work on the site is commenced.

Condition : 2 - No process shall be carried on or machinery installed which
    is not such as could be carried on or installed in any
    residential area without detriment to the amenity of that
    area by reason of noise, vibration, smell, fumes, smoke,
    soot, ash, dust or grit.

Condition : 3 - All trees on site shall be retained, unless the Council's
    express approval has been granted for their removal.The
    trees to be retained shall be protected against damage
    during the course of construction works.

Condition : 4 - Full details of hard and soft landscaping and means of
    approved by the Council.
    enclosure of all unbuilt upon open areas shall be submitted
    for the approval of the Council and shall be implemented,
    to the satisfaction of the Council prior to the occupation
    of each phase of the development for its permitted use, and
    satisfactorily maintained until a minimum of one full
    growing season has elapsed following completion.Any plant
    materials that are dead or severely damaged at the end of
    this period shall be replaced by specimens as originally

Condition : 5 - The details of all servicing arrangements and the layout of
    car parking spaces should not be otherwise than as shall
    have been submitted to and approved by the Council before
    any work on the site is commenced.

Condition : 6 - No loading or unloading of goods, including fuel, by
    vehicles arriving at or departing from the premises shall
    be caried out otherwise than within the curtilage of the
    site or from Camden Lock Place, except with the agreement
    of the Local Authority.

Condition : 7 - The proposed new access from Chalk Farm Road to the new
    East Yard shall be for pedestrian use (including market
    barrows) only.

Condition : 8 - Details of the provision for access for disabled persons in
    compliance with the provisions of S.4 of the Chronically
    Sick and Disabled Persons Act 1970, and the 1985 Building
    Regulations (as amended by The Building (Disabled People)
    Regulations 1987) shall not be otherwise than as shall have
    been approved by the Council before any work on the site is
    commenced.

Condition : 9 - The studio floorspace hereby permitted shall only be used
    for the purposes of design, production or display of works
    of art or artefacts including painting, sculpture,
    photographs, models, books and prints or for any other use
    which shall have received the prior approval of the Council.

Condition : 10 - There shall be no exclusively retail shop units in the
    Centre or West Yards and any retail element in
    workshop/studio use shall be strictly ancillary as per the
    Secretary of States' letters of decision dated 11th
    February 1981 and the use of units 9, 10 and 11 shall
    therefore be restricted to retail outlets for the
    workshops/studios in the redevelopment scheme.

Condition : 11 - The use of the new East Yard and upper level of the retail
    hall for market activities shall be restricted to Saturdays,
    Sundays and Bank Holidays only.

Condition : 12 - The net floorspace of each retail shop unit hereby
    permitted shall not exceed 1,000 sq.ft.

Condition : 13 - Loading and unloading for market activities shall only take
    place between 7.00 and 9.15 in the morning and 18.00 and 20.
    00 in the evening from Camden Lock Place.

Condition : 14 - The minimum width of the main aisles between rows of stalls
    shall be 2 metres, and the distance between side rows of
    market stalls shall be a minimum of 1 metre, and
    operational gaps with a minimum width of 0.6 metres shall
    be provided every 3-4 stalls for access.

Condition : 15 - The maximum number of stalls measuring 1.8 x 1.5 metres
    (including 1.8 x 0.6 metres operational space and the same
    if back to back) to be provided in the new East Yard and
    upper level of the retail hall, as delineated in yellow on
    drawing no.NSD/31A and the illustrative market layout
    NSD/36A as submitted, shall be 125 provided that minimum
    aisle and operational gap width can be accommodated at all
    times.

Condition : 16 - All stalls serving food or drinks shall be located on the
    peripheries adjacent to services.

Condition : 17 - All stalls used for market activities shall be removed and
    stored on non-market days unless otherwise agreed with the
    Local Authority.

Condition : 18 - Details of the designs of the proposed market stalls and
    arrangement for their storage when the market is not in
    operation shall be submitted to and approved by the Local
    Planning Authority before the use in the location commences.

Condition : 19 - The roof of the Le Routier restaurant shall not be used for
    market stalls.

Condition : 20 - To ensure that the Council may be satisfied with the
    external appearance of the building.

Condition : 21 - To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and
    the area generally.
Condition : 22 - In order to preserve amenity.

Condition : 23 - In order that the Council may give consideration to the
    details of the proposed development.

Condition : 24 - In order that the Council may give consideration to the
    details of the proposed development.

Condition : 25 - -07. To avoid obstruction of the surrounding streets and to
    safeguard the amenitiesof adjacent premises and the safety
    of pedestrians.
Condition : 26 - In order to ensure compliance with the terms of the Act.

Condition : 27 - -11. To ensure that the accommodation is used in accordance
    with the intentions of the proposed scheme and is not used
    for unauthorised purposes and in order to protect the
    special character of the Camden Lock Area in accordance
    with policy EM7 of the Borough Plan.

Condition : 28 - In order not to prejudice the weekday uses of the workshops
    and other units within the Camden Lock complex and to
    safeguard the weekday amenities of local residents.

Condition : 29 - To avoid obstruction of the surrounding streets and to
    safeguard the amenities of adjacent premises and residents.

Condition : 30 - In the interests of public safety and to allow for
    wheelchair and pram access.

Condition : 31 - -19. To ensure that the arrangement and oeration of the
    market is satisfactory and to enable the Council to ensure
    a reasonable standard of amenity and safety, and prevent
    overuse of the site.

Condition : 32 - 01Works of construction which could cause noise nuisance to
    the public.(ii) the sale of food etc. 03Your attention is
    drawn to the need to comply with the Health and Safetyat
    Work Act 1974 regarding the safety of employers, employees,
    self-employed persons and members of the public. 04-D09.
    See decision on Statutory Register.
    adjoining  residents should not take place otherwise than
    between the hours of  8.00am to 6.00pm Monday to Friday and
    8.00am to 1.00pm Saturday, withno working on Sunday or Bank
    Holidays in order to comply with locallyenforced standards.
    02The Director of Environmental Health and Consumer
    Services should be  consulted to meet any statutory
    requirements with respect to:-  (i) the provision of
    sufficient public toilet accommodation for stallholders and
